name: Contaminants & Soil Pollution Indicators
functionStatement: Physical and chemical processes limit pollutants, retain beneficial constituents, and protect ecological and human uses.
descriptionMarkdown: "Screening metric used to evaluate Water & soil quality based on the definition and bin thresholds provided for this metric. No chemical/fecal contamination signs; soils appear natural, no suspicious odors/staining."
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Watershed and Channel; Floodplain

Method: Desktop (listings/monitoring) and/or Field screening; Field
howToMeasureMarkdown: "Use available GIS layers/imagery and/or a field screening (as applicable) to quantify or rate the metric according to the provided bin thresholds. Inspect soils for odor or staining and review contaminated-site registries where relevant."

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Natural soils with no contamination indicators. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Minor dumping or moderate manure presence. / Known moderate contamination risk. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Highly contaminated soils with strong odor or toxicity indicators. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)
